attributes.action: Ban Drone Flying Over Private Property Without Owner’s Consent
attributes.additional_details:
The increasing use of drones has raised significant concerns over privacy, safety, and security for property owners across the UK. Current regulations  do not provide adequate protection for individuals who wish to maintain their right to privacy on their own property.

Key issues
Privacy Violations – unauthorised surveillance, photography & recording, 
Safety Risks - crashes / wildlife 
Security Concerns – trespassing, spying - creating security vulnerabilities for homeowners
attributes.background: We call on the UK Government to ban the flying of drones over private property without the owner’s consent, except for emergency services or other legally authorised uses. This is to protect privacy, security, and peace of mind for property owners.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Ban people from flying drones over police stations and private properties
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/712074
